There was a large command center complete with several large view screens a=
nd other smaller ones lining the walls. Each one depicting a different scen=
e =96 one looked at a patch of jungle, another at a river. Some were lookin=
g at prison cells and other at halls and corridors. 

In the center of all =
of this DARK RODIMUS, watching one that showed LEO PRIME and HYDRAS plus th=
e PREDACONS and MAXIMALS that were coming with them. 

"A most interesting =
exercise isn't it?" MAGMATRON said from behind DARK RODIMUS. He hadn't been=
 there a minute ago and it caused DARK RODIMUS to jump. 

MAGMATRON smiled,=
 he knew DARK RODIMUS hated when he did that, but he also knew that the bot=
 was too stubborn to admit it. 

"What do you mean?" DARK RODIMUS said afte=
r a moment of recovering his composure. 

Gesturing at the screen MAGMATRON=
 stepped forward the light of the view screen casting evil shadows across h=
is frame, "All this power coming right to us - Leo Prime bringing us his sh=
ard of the shard of his Matrix." There was a pause and a smile, "They belie=
ve they are coming to do battle with me, and yet they are all coming bringi=
ng me a gift." 

MAGMATRON chuckled again. "The dinosaurs opened a path for=
 them and then their death's led them back to us." He looked at DARK RODIMU=
S, "Even you have played your role in drawing them all here."

DARK RODIMUS=
' optics flared brightly, "So all I am is just a pawn in your games?" He ba=
lled his fists as if ready to fight, which of course made MAGMATRON chuckle=
 all the more. 

"Did I not say you are my knight?" MAGMATRON laid a calmin=
g hand on DARK RODIMUS' tense shoulder. "You are the piece that moves in su=
rprising ways."

There was a pause and then a nod from DARK RODIMUS. "What =
of Tuscon?" He said as he looked back up at MAGMATRON, "Does he not bare so=
me of the power of the Matrix as well?"

MAGMATRON nodded, "Yes, but he doe=
s not have it himself." He stroked his chin, "But he may prove useful after=
 all."

"Then let me recapture him." DARK RODIMUS said, his optics bright a=
nd clear. "I shall bring him before you groveling."

There was a nod from M=
AGMATRON, "Yes of course, bring him to me and we shall complete our set."

=
DARK RODIMUS straightened and then snapped a salute before turning on a hee=
l and walking out the door. 

As the door slid closed behind him another vo=
ice came out from the darkness. "He is an interesting one isn't he."

"Yes =
Saberback he is." MAGMATRON said without turning. Instead he looked at one =
of the screens, the one that showed TUSCON transforming into his dragon mod=
e and attempting to attack the guards. 

"Too bad they will all have to die=
." SABERBACK said humorlessly. 

MAGMATRON just watched the screen as he fo=
lded his arms over his chest. He said nothing. 

"Perhaps we should have so=
meone collect the female that your Dark Knight seems to have a fondness for=
." SABERBACK said in a crafty voice. "He may need some . . . incentive to s=
tay in his role later on."

There was a nod from MAGMATRON, "Make it so."

=
There was a chuckle as SABERBACK faded back into the darkness. 

. . . . . =
